item.description:
Hear how others funded their startups!  This month we'll hear from the founders of Burst ($3.45M raised), sqrrl ($2M raised) and Adapteva ($1.5M+).  We leave plenty of time for networking and one-on-one conversations too.

  • Paul Levy, co-founder, Burst, a mobile solution for families, is providing the next generation of video and photo services for today’s mobile and social users.  Burst is based in Boston and is backed ($3.45M) by an influential and successful group of high-net worth angels who have worked with Burst executives for more than 10 years.
  • Ely Kahn, co-founder, sqrrl data Inc., a Cambridge, Mass.-based start-up focused on commercializing the Apache Accumulo database.  Initially developed at the NSA, sqrrl's technology was born from the needs of the National Security Agency and recently secured $2 million in seed funding to develop secure database technology.
  • Andreas Olofsson, founder, Adapteva Inc., Lexington-based chip maker (A $1.5 million series A round and a $854K in debt financing.)

Registration, networking and a light breakfast start at 8:00 am.  Panel begins promptly at 9:00 am.  We ask our panelists to talk about:

  • How they got their introductions to potential funders
  • Who was the most helpful and got introductions for them
  • How they decided what kind of funding they were targeting and how much they needed
  • How far along did they have to be to get funded
  • How they structured the round
  • And more.
item.name: Funded Founders Panel and networking
